intro: Hibbertia haplostemona, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of southern Australia. Hibbertia haplostemona has small, ovate leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
